title.narrative: OUTPUT 4: CONDUCIVE BEHAVIOURS & PRACTICES FOR CHILD PROTECTION IN DEV. & EMERGEN

description.narrative: By 2022, duty-bearers and rights-holders have improved, conducive attitudes and practices, that contribute to positive social and cultural norms, which prevent harmful practices and violence against children, including in developmental and emergency situations. , which contributes to Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, duty-bearers and rights-holders have improved, conducive attitudes and practices, that contribute to positive social andcultural norms, which prevent harmful practices and violence against children, including in developmental and emergency situations.

description.narrative: Important steps towards systematizing and institutionalizing social and behaviour change activities were taken as a framework to guide the implementation of prevention of abuse and promotion of child protection services was finalized and endorsed by provincial governments with UNICEF support. A KAP study was completed to understand drivers of child protection concerns across the country. With UNICEF support, 13.6 million people were reached with messages on violence against children, gender-based violence and stigma prevention in the context of COVID-19. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:04/01/2022
